PathOfBuilding.Notes:
3.23 Havoc Manaforged Lightning Arrow Deadeye (No Totems)
^xD02090^7Twitch:^7^7 ^xE05030^x8888FF^xE05030^x8888FF^x3F6DB3https://www.twitch.tv/havoc616^7^7^7^7^7 ^xE05030^7Youtube:^7^7 ^xE05030^x3F6DB3^x8888FF^x7070FF^xE05030^x7070FF^x8888FF^x3F6DB3https://www.youtube.com/@havoc616vods^7^7^x8888FF
^xAF6025> Table of Contents <^7^7 Who is this PoB for? Build Pros Build Cons Leveling - Gem Progression Leveling - Passive Tree Notes Gear - Notes Gear - Crafting Maps - Map Progression Maps - An Example Atlas Setup (Brief) Wildwood Ascendancy (Theory) Filter FAQ
^xAF6025> Who is this PoB for? <^7 - SC Trade or SC SSF Players - Who want to play LIGHTNING ARROW DEADEYE (No Totems) from LEVEL 12 - Who want to RUSH to 2 or 4 Voidstones (^x8888FF^x3F6DB3https://youtu.be/_-hibuh5DA4^7^7)
^xAF6025> Build Pros <^7 - Don't get hit Playstyle - SSF 3Hour A10 Kitava & 6H Eater Exarch Viable (^x8888FF^x3F6DB3https://youtu.be/_-hibuh5DA4^7^7) - Excellent Clearspeed - High Endgame Ceiling and Multiple Lategame Farming Options
^xAF6025> Build Cons <^7 - Don't get hit Playstyle - Will randomly die without finetuning the character (Example: Not capping supression) - Extensive experienced required for Hardcore
^xAF6025> Leveling <^7
^xFFFF77regex:^7 -[rgb]-.-|g-g-|-g-g|g-.-g|g-g|nne|rint|serrat
^xAF6025A1^7 Level 2: After Hillock ^x70FF70Galvanic Arrow^7 - ^x70FF70Momentum^7
Level 4: After Hailrake ^x70FF70Galvanic Arrow^7^7 - ^x70FF70Mirage Archer ^7 ^x70FF70Shrapnel Ballista^7 - ^x70FF70Momentum^7 (Shrapnel Ballista is Optional) ^x70FF70Sniper's Mark^7 ^x70FF70Dash^7
Level 8: After Lower Prison & Completeing Dweller ^x70FF70Galvanic Arrow^7^7^7 - ^x70FF70Mirage Archer ^7- ^x70FF70Momentum^7 or ^x70FF70Added Cold^7^7 (Optional if 3G) ^x70FF70^x70FF70Burning Arrow - Manaforged Arrows Support Sniper's Mark^7 ^x70FF70^x3F6DB3Frostblink^7 ^xE05030Warbanner^7 ^xC8C8C8^7 Leve^7^7l 10: After Brutus Add ^x70FF70Blink Arrow^7 to the above setup
Level 12: After Reaching Cavern of Wrath and Completing Fairgraves ^x70FF70^x70FF70^x70FF70^x70FF70Lightning Arrow ^7- ^x70FF70Mirage Archer ^7- ^x70FF70Lesser Multiple Projectiles ^7(^7^x70FF70Momentum^7^7 OR ^x70FF70Added Cold^7^7 single target swap) ^x70FF70^x70FF70Burning Arrow - Manaforged Arrows Support - Galvanic Arrow^7^7^7 ^x70FF70Sniper's Mark^7^7 ^x70FF70Blink Arrow^7 ^x70FF70^x3F6DB3Frostblink^7 ^xE05030Warbanner^7
^xD02090NOTE: ^7If you Prefer Rain of Arrows you can use ^x70FF70Rain of Arrows^7 - ^x70FF70Mirage Archer ^7- DAMAGE SUPPORT & Add ^x70FF70Lightning Arrow^7 to a ^x70FF70Manaforged Setup^7 or Level in your offhand to swap to Later
^xAF6025A2^7 Level 16: After Fidelitas Add ^x70FF70Herald of Ice^7 Add ^x70FF70Frenzy^7 to a ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows^7 setup (Replace Galvanic or Burning Arrow ideally)
^xD02090Optional:^7^7 Purchase ^x7070FF^x7070FF^x3F6DB3Herald of Thunder^7^7^7 (Requires a Lapis Amulet or Intelligence Item) ^xD02090Optional:^7^7 Purchase ^x70FF70Arctic Armour^7 to swap with Herald of Ice in A5 or Onward
Level 18: After Weaver Free: ^x3F6DB3Trinity^7 or ^xE05030EDWAS^7 -- Purchase the Other One ^xD02090Optional^7:^7 You can delay this step until you have a 4L (Usually in Act 3)
Bandits: ^xE05030^xFFFF77^xD02090^xFFFF77HELP ALIRA^7^7^7^7
After The Way Forward - Travel back to Act 1: Purchase: ^xE05030Steelskin^7 ^xD02090Optional:^7 ^x70FF70Extra Manaforged Arrows^7, ^x70FF70LMP^7 (If you didn't get one earlier), ^x70FF70Precision^7
^xD02090^7
^xAF6025A3^7 Level 24: After Tolman Purchase: ^xE05030Anger^7 Free: ^x70FF70Grace^7 from Maramoa (Level in offhand) ^xD02090Optional:^7 ^7Buy ^x70FF70Haste^7 and use Haste when travelling between zones, aura swap to ^xE05030Anger^7 on Bosses ^xD02090Optional:^7^7 Buy a ^xC8C8C8Heavy Belt^7
Solaris 2: ^xFFFF77Rare Lapis Amulet^7
Level 28: After Gravicius Free: ^x70FF70Storm Rain^7 --> Add to Manaforged Setup ^xD02090Optional:^7 Purchase ^x70FF70Blast Rain^7
Example Setup at this Point (Colours and Link Dependent) ^x70FF70Lightning Arrow^7 ^7- ^x70FF70Mirage Archer ^7- ^x70FF70LMP ^7- ^x3F6DB3Trinity^7 ^x70FF70^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows Support ^7-^7 ^x70FF70Storm Rain^7 - ^x70FF70Blast Rain^7 ^x70FF70Manaforged Arrows Support^7 ^7-^7 ^x70FF70Frenzy ^x70FF70Sniper's Mark^7^7, ^x70FF70Blink Arrow^7, ^x70FF70^x3F6DB3Frostblink^7 ^xE05030Warbanner^7, ^xE05030Anger^7, ^x70FF70HoI^7
^xD02090Optional:^7^7 Complete Library Purchase ^xE05030Lifetap^7 -- Add to the Storm Rain / Blast Rain Manaforged Arrows Setup Purchase ^x3F6DB3Flamedash^7 -- Swap with ^x3F6DB3Frostblink^7
Normal Lab: Gathering Winds
^xAF6025A4^7 Level 38: After Malachai Purchase: ^x70FF70Barrage^7 (1 ALCHEMY) --> Gem Swap with LMP or Returning Projectiles during Boss Fights Free: ^x70FF70Returning Projectiles^7 Free: ^x70FF70Tornado^7
You can drop LMP after allocating +2 Arrows on Tree (Master Fletcher, Multishot)
^xAF6025A5^7^7 Jade Flask
^xAF6025A6^7 After Lily Roth if you did not complete the Library Earlier Purchase ^xE05030Lifetap^7 -- Add to the Storm Rain / Blast Rain Manaforged Arrows Setup Purchase ^x3F6DB3Flamedash^7 -- Swap with ^x3F6DB3Frostblink^7
Major Pantheon: Brine King Minor Pantheon: Ryslatha
^xAF6025A7^7 Cruel Lab: Farshot Diamond Flask
^xAF6025A8^7 Run ^x70FF70Grace^7 in The High Gardens when Completing the Yugul Quest
^xAF6025A9^7 Free ^xFFFF77Spike-Point Arrow Quiver^7
^xAF6025A10^7 Silver Flask Free ^xFFFF77Zodiac Leather ^7or^7 ^xAF6025^xFFFF77Blood Raiment ^7Base^7 Merc Lab: Endless Munitions
^xAF6025> Leveling - Passive Tree Notes <^7 - Bows are VERY FLEXIBLE in Passive Tree order. Feel free to deviate and experiment! - Burning Brutality and Weathered Hunter are EXCELLENT early game nodes that will provide A LOT OF DAMAGE, ALL RESIST & ACCURACY BUT will delay the Crit Swap - 30 ^xE05030Strength^7 & ^x3F6DB3Intelligence^7 nodes will be required from time to time and are not show in the tree progression. Consider keeping ^x3F6DB3Frostblink/FlameDash^7 & ^xE05030Warbanner^7 at Level 1.
^xD02090MAKE SURE YOU GET THE LIGHTNING DAMAGE CRAFTS^7 4 Transmutes - PREFIX - LOCATION: Act 3 TOP LEFT of Piety's Arena in Lunaris Level 2 2 Alchemy - Prefix - LOCATION: Act 7 Chamber of Sins Level 2 by the Map Device
^xD02090When should one swap to CRIT?^7 a) Force it at Level 60+ no matter the Bow & Passive Tree setup b) Wait till a Crit Bow Base or any Bow with Above 5% Crit c) Increased Critical Strikes Support can be a valid 5th Gem, best paired with Increased Critical Damage Support.
Note: The reason to swap to crit earlier, even if it is equal or potentially worse during early progression is because efficient non-crit scaling runs out of damage by T16 content and is surpassed by crit.
^xAF6025> Gear - Notes <^7^7 ^xD02090Annoint^7 a) Fury Bolts: Verdant Verdant Teal (excellent early option) b) Divine Judgement: Sepia Teal Black
^xD02090Unveils of Interest^7 (Early Prog only)
Wherever you can fit it: SUFFIX ^x3F6DB3Cold^7/^xB97123Fire^7/^xADAA47Lightning^7 & ^xD02090CHAOS^7 Resist Crafts
Belt - SUFFIX ^x7070FFRegenerate 150 Energy Shield per second while a Rare or Unique Enemy is Nearby^7 Gloves - SUFFIX ^x7070FF(31-36)% increased Attack and Cast Speed while Focused^7 Helmet: Korell PREFIX ^x7070FF(7-8)% of Physical Damage from Hits taken as Fire Damage^7 Chest: Gravicius PREFIX ^xC8C8C8^x7070FF(5-6)% of Physical Damage from Hits taken as Fire Damage, (5-6)% of Physical Damage from Hits taken as Lightning Damage^7^7
^xAF6025> Gear - Crafting <^7^7^7
^xD02090Method 1 = Wisdom Scroll Crafting^7 =)
^xD02090Method 2 = Essence Crafting^7
^xFFFF77Bow - Spine Bows - Screaming/Shrieking WRATH, HATRED, ANGER, ZEAL
^xFFFF77Quiver^7 - Broadhead Arrow Quiver, Feathered Arrow Quiver - Screaming+ TORMENT, SUFFERING, ANGUISH, DREAD (with Projectile Speed Mastery)
^xFFFF77Rings / Amulet^7 - Screaming+ TORMENT, SUFFERING, ANGUISH, SCORN
^xFFFF77Helm^7 - Deicide Mask, Lion Pelt - Screaming+ GREED, RAGE, LOATHING (For Multi Aura Setups that Pursue 2x 50% + AA + Precision Late Game)
^xFFFF77Body Armour^7 - Sadist Garb, Assassin's Garb - Screaming+ GREED, WOE (For Life Mastery), LOATHING (For Multi Aura Setups that Pursue 2x 50% + AA + Precision Late Game)
^xFFFF77Gloves^7 - Slink Gloves - Screaming+ ZEAL, GREED, For Resists: Screaming+ WRATH, HATRED, ANGER
^xFFFF77Boots^7 - Slink Boots - Shrieking+ ZEAL, GREED, For Resists: Screaming+ WRATH, HATRED, ANGER
^xFFFF77Belt^7 - Heavy Belt, Stygian Vise - Screaming+ RAGE (Strength), For Resists: WRATH, HATRED, ANGER
^xAF6025> Maps - Map Progre^xAF6025ssion < ^7^xE05030If you want to gear up:^7 - beginner recommended - farm low level maps quickly - work with PoB to upgrade damage Essence Rush 31 Points: https://poeplanner.com/atlas-tree/BAAMAB8AXz54-NDYes6EKm2Ip-Iw-vxNF7r43-jyBmqINKykK3ECrkWXyySne92DPQq8SekoJ4UbCJDZj-XCdsQW2cYUAB-LCAAAAAAAAAMDAAAAAAAAAAAA Essence + Jun 46 Points: https://poeplanner.com/atlas-tree/BAAMAC4AXz54-NDYes6EKm2Ip-Iw-vxNfKvZW_2MF7r43-jyBmqINJ7YrKQrcU3aAq5Fl8skp3vdg-eu4RA9Cq2V6-H14rxJ6Sii0CeFGwiQ2cOXj-XCdqlDyVrEFtnGLbMUAB-LCAAAAAAAAAMDAAAAAAAAAAAA
^xE05030If you want to rush: (can be difficult)^7 Wandering Path Rush 19 Points: https://poeplanner.com/atlas-tree/BAAMABcAXz6EKjD6i-F9kZtY3v6INKykK3EpjUWX3YOzx_uxvEle38Qf0p4LcY_ltWPQKBQAH4sIAAAAAAAAAwMAAAAAAAAAAAA= Get 100% Adjacent 45 Points: https://poeplanner.com/atlas-tree/BAAMAC0AXz54gIQqMPq1ZsGgjerZWx19i-F9kZtYJ3Xe_og0ntispCtxKY1w40WXxKbdg7PH0w7hEH21goj7scSFvEle36LQJDLEH9KekYkLcY_liaOpQ7Vj1GyH1NAoFAAfiwgAAAAAAAADAwAAAAAAAAAAAA==
^7 ^xAF6025> Maps - An Example Atlas Setup (Brief) <^7
I will run something like this:
Searing Exarch Altars Currency & XP Farm Delirium Breach (if an open map layout is available, good for xp!) Ultimatum (if we can complete it without fail)
Pick 2 ADJACENT MAPS -- Example Combo: 1 Narrow Fast Farmer (Example: Waste Pool). KIRAC MODIFIER: Domination or Ambush. 1 Open Layout Map (Good for Breaches, Example: Mud Geyser) KIRAC MODIFIER: Breach or Ambush or Beyond. Use a Wandering Path Atlas Tree.
Playstyle: DO MAPS FAST Click Altars that provide Value but do not brick the character/map.
There are 3 Tiers of Progression for this Farm No League Mechanics - Can do this after Eater Exarch and some basic Power Level. Add a League Mechanic - In this farm, Breach and/or Ultimatum. Requires more character Power. Multiply it with Beyond - Very difficult. Requires strong damage, survivability, & attentiveness to playstyle.
^xAF6025> Wildwood Ascendancy (Theory) < ^7- In Theory Available from A2 Onward - Movement Speed is a very strong stat on Deadeyes - Thus, ^x70FF70Warden of the Maji^7 is recommended to possibly select^7 ^xD02090OATH of the MAJI^7 for ^xD02090"30% increased Movement Speed if you have Equipped Boots with no Socketed Gems"^7
I would try to run only a Singular Manaforged Setup and drop optional gems during progression to make it work Strong 4Link or 4Socket bows (and items in general) will help make this work There is also a very strong argument to forgo sockets in boots altogether, even during maps. And only putting an Extra Manaforged Setup (that was being leveled in the offhand) on boss fights.
If we strongly value ^xD02090OATH of the MAJI^7 & choose to play as a ^x70FF70Warden^7 then the following notables are of interest. ^xD02090Coated Blade ^7- Apply Tinctures to Weapons (Should be very strong and most likely mandatory)^7 ^xD02090Nature's Concoction^7^7 - For Flask Uptime --> More Damage or Survivability during Boss Fights ^xD02090Enduring Suffusion^7 - Depending on the Tincture, can be incredibly strong
Of lesser interest ^xD02090Wildwood Blessing^7 - More evasion early on helps mitigate no Grace ^xD02090Lesson of the Seasons^7 - Potential Ailment Immunity angle
^xAF6025> Filter < ^7 3.22 Race Filters You can find them here ^x3F6DB3https://www.pathofexile.com/account/view-profile/Havoc6/item-filters^7 Download SOUNDS into your ^xFFFF77"C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Path of Exile"^7 Folder
^xD02090Note: ^7 ^xE05030USE AT YOUR OWN RISK^7 You need the sound files ^x3F6DB3https://discord.gg/havoc616^7 Swap to something else in Act 3/4/5+++
^xAF6025> FAQ <^7
^xD02090Rain of Arrows or Lightning Arrow at Level 12. Pros & Cons?^7 Rain of Arrows is much faster than other bow skills during leveling but requires an intentional effort to kill more monsters in comparison to skills such as Lightning Arrow. Lightning Arrow will be slightly slower at progression but should offer a bit more XP and Gear during progression.
Example: RoA = 3H A10 Kitava, Gear not so great ^x3F6DB3https://youtu.be/f0riwWC_CZk^7 Lightning Arrow = 3h13m A10 Kitava, Strong Gear ^x3F6DB3https://youtu.be/_-hibuh5DA4^7
^xD02090Manaforged Arrows versus Totems?^7 - I found both setups to do equal damage versus Searing Exarch - Supplemental Totems will feel good in A1/A2. A3+ they felt equal. - Pick whichever version fits your playstyle. It's basically changing a singular 4L
^xD02090When do I swap to Crit?^7 a) Force it at Level 60 to 70+ no matter the Bow & Passive Tree setup (this is what I've been doing) b) Wait till a Crit Bow Base or any Bow with Above 5% Crit c) Increased Critical Strikes Support can be a valid 5th Gem, best paired with Increased Critical Damage Support.
Note: The reason to swap to crit earlier, even if it is equal or potentially worse during early progression is because efficient non-crit scaling runs out of damage by T16 content and is surpassed by crit.
^xD02090I'm dying to Elemental Spell Damage^7 - Are you Resist Capped - Are you Spell Supression Capped - Are you Spell Supression Capped without Revenge of the Hunted
^xD02090I'm dying to Physical Damage^7 - Run Arctic Armour - Craft Physical Damage taken as X Elemental Modifiers on Helmet (from Korell) and Chest (from Gravicius, somewhat rare)
^xD02090I feel like I'm getting surrounded and dying to just a lot of attacks at once^7 - High ^x70FF70Evasion^7 Helps: Consider running ^x70FF70Grace ^7or a Jade Flask - ^x70FF70Arctic Armour^7 Helps - Phasing (via on Kill Effects or a Quartz Flask) Helps - ^xE05030CWDT + Steelskin^7 or ^xE05030CWDT + Immortal Call^7 Helps - Don't Get Hit --> Try to Offscreen Monsters. We are a ranged build, use it!
^xD02090Why do you run Arctic Armour?^7 - "Buff grants (11-21)%^xAF6025 less Physical Damage taken from Hits^7 while stationary" - "Buff grants (11-20)% less Fire Damage taken from Hits while stationary" - "Buff grants ^x3F6DB3Immunity to Freeze^7"
We are Stationary every time we attack.
^xD02090Why do you take Ghost Dance? ^7For some reason, Ghost Shrouds are incredibily underrated as a defensive stat for mid-game progression and endgame mapping or bossing. Best paired with Evasion (10K+) and a Moderate ES Pool (200-300 or much more).
^xD02090Why not Raider?^7 Raider doesn't offer enough damage and the majority of it's stats can be found on gear or the passive tree.^xD02090
What do you swap Barrage with? ^7Either Returning Projectiles or Mirage Archer^7
^xD02090Why no Piercing Shots?^7 You can allocate it during mapping. 3 Pierce is unnecessary during boss fights.
^xD02090How to sustain Lifetap + Manaforged early?^7 2 Life Flasks Clever Thief + Instant leech (Great option) Vitality (optional) Sharktooth Arrow Base Quiver Use Lifetap support later (happens often due to socket pressure)
^xD02090Why help Alira? Can we kill all Bandits?^7 In a "rush" scenario we don't want to spend too much time gearing and want to focus on pushing harder content. 15% All Res and Crit Multi is very valuable in this context. Late game, getting 20 regrets can be used to fix it with better gear (if deemed necessary)
^xD02090What is the Maven UberElder v2 Aura Nodes Tree?^7 Optional skill tree routing if you want to run: - 2 50% Auras (Grace Anger) - 1 25% Aura (Arctic Armour) - & Precision (With Increased Mana Reservation Efficiency on Helm or Chest via a Loathing Essence)o
